{{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox Broadcast | | call_letters = DWCP-TV (Talk TV 21)| | city = [[Mandaluyong City]] | station_logo = [[File:Talk TV Philippines.png|150px]]
[[Image:Sbn 21.png|150px]]| | station_slogan = See [[Southern Broadcasting Network#SBN Slogans]]| | station_branding = ''Talk TV-21 Manila''| | analog = 21 ([[Ultra high frequency|UHF]])| | digital = | | affiliations = [[Talk TV (Philippines)|Talk TV]]| | founded = May, 1992| | location = [[Metro Manila]]| | owner = [[Southern Broadcasting Network]]| | callsign_meaning = | | former_affiliations = | | former_callsigns = | | effective_radiated_power = (TPO:40KW)(ERP:500 KW)| | homepage = | }} '''SBN 21''' (DWCP-TV 21), is a [[television station]] of [[Southern Broadcasting Network]] , with main broadcast facilities at [[Mandaluyong City]]. became the first local [[UHF]] TV station in Metro Manila in May, 1992 also known as World TV 21. ==History== Southern Broadcasting Network of Davao launched SBN Channel 21, the first local UHF TV station in Metro Manila after the opening of another UHF station, [[DYET-TV]]. It was then known as ''World TV 21''. The idea is to bring back programming similar to the forcibly shut-down [[Far East Network|FEN Channel 17]] of the former Clark US Air Base a year earlier due to the eruption of Mt. Pinatubo. ==SBN Stations== *see [[Southern Broadcasting Network#SBN TV stations]] ==Talk TV programs== {{Main|List of programs broadcast by Talk TV}} ==SBN slogans== {{main|Southern Broadcasting Network#SBN Slogans}} {{Metro Manila TV}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dwcp-Tv}} [[Category:Television stations in Metro Manila]] {{Philippines-tv-stub}} [[ceb:DWCP-TV]] [[tl:DWCP-TV]]
